SEARCH
Package presentation.graphics

Class Sketcher

java.lang.Object
presentation.graphics.Sketcher
public class Sketcher extends Object
The class is for drawing graphics in the Java GUI game. Provides methods for drawing the components of the game (entities, scores, and backgrounds. It can also draw text on the screen)

  • Constructor Summary

    Sketcher(JPanel enteredPanel)
    The constructor takes a panel as a parameter and assigns it to the attribute

  • Constructor Details

    • Sketcher

      public Sketcher(JPanel enteredPanel)
      The constructor takes a panel as a parameter and assigns it to the attribute
      Parameters:
      enteredPanel - used to set any panel on which graphic elements will be drawn

  • Method Details

    • drawEntities

      public int drawEntities(Graphics graphics, ArrayList<Entity> entities)
      Iterates through the list of entities and draws each one by calling the drawImage method
      Parameters:
      graphics - This graphics context allows the drawEntities method to draw the entities in the appropriate panel of the application
      entities - represents each individual entity found in the list
      Returns:
      The method returns 0 if all entities are drawn correctly and 1 if there is at least one entity that cannot be drawn

    • drawScore

      public void drawScore(Graphics graphics, int points)
      Draws the score in the graphical context specified by graphics.
      Parameters:
      graphics - graphic context in which the drawing is made
      points - represents the score that will be drawn in the graphical context

    • drawBackground

      public void drawBackground(Graphics graphics, Rectangle bounds, Color backGroundColor, float transparencyBackGroundValue)
      Draws a rectangular background with a specific color and transparency in the graphic context provided by graphics
      Parameters:
      graphics - Object Graphics that represents the graphic context in which the drawing will be made
      bounds - Object Rectangle that represents the boundaries of the rectangular background to be drawn
      backGroundColor - Color object that represents the color of the background
      transparencyBackGroundValue - float that represents the transparency of the background

    • drawText

      public void drawText(Graphics graphics, JPanel panel, Color textColor, String text, int xPosition, int yPosition)
      Draws text in a graphical context provided by graphics
      Parameters:
      graphics - Graphics object that represents the graphic context in which the text will be drawn
      panel - JPanel object that represents the panel on which the text will be drawn
      textColor - Color object that represents the color of the text
      text - string representing the text being drawn
      xPosition - Horizontal coordinate where the text will begin
      yPosition - Vertical coordinate where the text will begin
